sections.heading: operators; conductors; intoxication; penalty
sections.text: Any person who is intoxicated while in charge of a locomotive running upon the track of any railroad or while acting as the conductor of a car or train of cars on any railroad shall be guilty of a Class I misdemeanor.SourceR.S.1866, c. 25, § 108, p. 227;R

74-921.Locomotive operators; conductors; intoxication; penalty.

Any person who is intoxicated while in charge of a locomotive running upon the track of any railroad or while acting as the conductor of a car or train of cars on any railroad shall be guilty of a Class I misdemeanor.

SourceR.S.1866, c. 25, § 108, p. 227;R.S.1913, § 6057;C.S.1922, § 5414;C.S.1929, § 74-706;R.S.1943, § 74-706;Laws 1977, LB 39, § 188;R.S.1943, (1990), § 74-706;Laws 1994, LB 414, § 21.
